alert.note: Alert for Burnett (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 22 at 6:21PM CDT until further notice by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR CLAM LAKE AND DOWNSTREAM PORTIONS OF THE CLAM RIVER REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rainfall and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Burnett County in northwest Wisconsin at Clam Lake and locations downstream of the lake along the Clam River. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM CDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Structures along Clam Lake have been flooded over the last week due to very elevated lake levels. Downstream flow is elevated along the Clam River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 617 PM CDT, Friday, emergency management reported flooding in structures along the banks of Clam Lake. Flooding is already occurring. - Elevated flows are occurring along the Clam River downstream of Clam Lake. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Siren, Webster, and Saint Croix State Park. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood.
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. Report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and to the National Weather Service in Duluth when you can do so safely. Flooding can be reported to the National Weather Service at 1-800-685-8612.
